articles.headline: Deadly Iran Protests Prompt Warning of Harsher Response
articles.snippet: The rallies are the biggest in years, and are breaking out in areas once reliably loyal to the government.
articles.abstract: The rallies are the biggest in years, and are breaking out in areas once reliably loyal to the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Ignoring pleas for calm from President Hassan Rouhani, Iranian protesters took to the streets in several cities for the fifth day on Monday as pent-up economic and political frustrations boiled over in the broadest display of discontent in years.

articles.headline: With Disney Deal Looming, Murdoch’s Empire Is Fractured
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch’s decision to sell most of 21st Century Fox has many wondering what the future holds for him and the two sons who seemed on the cusp of taking over his vast empire.
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch’s decision to sell most of 21st Century Fox has many wondering what the future holds for him and the two sons who seemed on the cusp of taking over his vast empire.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — In late summer, Verizon Communications came to Rupert Murdoch with a surprise acquisition offer.
articles.byline: By Brooks Barnes and Sydney Ember

articles.headline: Fighting Climate Change, One Laundry Load at a Time
articles.snippet: Experts in the study of fungi are playing a bigger role in improving laundry detergents and, by extension, leading efforts to cut energy use.
articles.abstract: Experts in the study of fungi are playing a bigger role in improving laundry detergents and, by extension, leading efforts to cut energy use.
articles.lead_paragraph: COPENHAGEN — A Danish biotechnology company is trying to fight climate change — one laundry load at a time. Its secret weapon: mushrooms like those in a dormant forest outside Copenhagen.

articles.headline: How Antivirus Software Can Be Turned Into a Tool for Spying
articles.snippet: Government officials warn that software from Kaspersky Lab could be subverted by Russian intelligence. A security researcher shows how it could be done.
articles.abstract: Government officials warn that software from Kaspersky Lab could be subverted by Russian intelligence. A security researcher shows how it could be done.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been a secret, long known to intelligence agencies but rarely to consumers, that security software can be a powerful spy tool.

articles.headline: The Trump Effect: Business, Anticipating Less Regulation, Loosens Purse Strings
articles.snippet: The administration’s campaign to reduce regulation has improved the mood of business executives. They may be spending more money as a result.
articles.abstract: The administration’s campaign to reduce regulation has improved the mood of business executives. They may be spending more money as a result.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A wave of optimism has swept over American business leaders, and it is beginning to translate into the sort of investment in new plants, equipment and factory upgrades that bolsters economic growth, spurs job creation — and may finally raise wages significantly.
articles.byline: By Binyamin Appelbaum and Jim Tankersley

articles.headline: Emboldened Israeli Right Presses Moves to Doom 2-State Solution
articles.snippet: After President Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s party has seized momentum to strengthen Israel’s rule of the West Bank.
articles.abstract: After President Trump’s recognition of Jerusalem as Israel’s capital, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s party has seized momentum to strengthen Israel’s rule of the West Bank.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — An emboldened Israeli right wing is moving quickly in the new year to make it far more difficult to create a Palestinian state, signaling its intention to doom hopes for a two-state solution to the conflict.

articles.headline: Toasts to the Deals (and Other Winners) of 2017
articles.snippet: The last year gave us some whopping deals, including Amazon.com’s acquisition of Whole Foods, that will shape the business landscape in 2018.
articles.abstract: The last year gave us some whopping deals, including Amazon.com’s acquisition of Whole Foods, that will shape the business landscape in 2018.

articles.headline: Hard-Liners and Reformers Tapped Iranians’ Ire. Now, Both Are Protest Targets.
articles.snippet: The demonstrations that have spread to dozens of Iranian cities were set off by miscalculations in a long-simmering internal power struggle.
articles.abstract: The demonstrations that have spread to dozens of Iranian cities were set off by miscalculations in a long-simmering internal power struggle.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Antigovernment protests roiled Iran on Tuesday, as the death toll rose to 21 and the nation’s supreme leader blamed foreign enemies for the unrest. But the protests that have spread to dozens of Iranian cities in the past six days were set off by miscalculations in a long-simmering power struggle between hard-liners and reformers.

articles.headline: Hoda Kotb Named to Replace Matt Lauer as Co-Anchor of NBC’s ‘Today’
articles.snippet: Ms. Kotb, a longtime NBC News correspondent, has filled in since Mr. Lauer was fired in November over allegations of inappropriate sexual behavior.
articles.abstract: Ms. Kotb, a longtime NBC News correspondent, has filled in since Mr. Lauer was fired in November over allegations of inappropriate sexual behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hoda Kotb, the longtime co-host of the fourth hour of the NBC morning franchise “Today,” will replace Matt Lauer as co-anchor of the program’s opening hours, the network said on Tuesday.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Prashant S. Rao
